articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Parisa Hafezi, Jana Choukeir
articles.description: An Israeli military official said 50 Israeli jets had struck around 20 targets in Tehran overnight.
articles.title: Thousands of Iranians flee Tehran bombing; Trump said to consider joining Israel in strikes

articles.author: Yurii Kovalenko, Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Flags across Kyiv were lowered to half-mast on Wednesday, as Ukrainians mourned more than two dozen people killed a day earlier in Russia's deadliest strike on the capital this year.
articles.title: Kyiv mourns as death toll from Russian strike climbs to 28

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli gunfire and strikes killed at least 30 people across the Gaza Strip on Wednesday, local health authorities said, as some Palestinians there said their plight was being forgotten as attention shifted to the air war between Israel and Iran.
articles.title: Israeli fire kills 30 in Gaza, medics say, as attention shifts to Iran

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The law is an attempt to ease a demographic crisis caused by Russia's war and to enhance ties with Ukraine's diaspora.
articles.title: Parliament passes law to allow multiple citizenship for Ukrainians

articles.author: David Ljunggren, John Irish, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will on Tuesday urge the Group of Seven to provide more backing for the war against Russia even after U.S. President Donald Trump left the summit early due to developments in the Middle East.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy to seek G7 support as Trump's early exit puts dampener on summit

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Shivam Patel
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump insisted on Wednesday that he had stopped the war between India and Pakistan, hours after Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi told him the ceasefire after a four-day conflict in May was achieved through talks between the neighbors' militaries, not U.S. mediation.
articles.title: Trump says he stopped India-Pakistan war after India says no US mediation

articles.author: Emily Rose
articles.description: Israel's military assault on Iran has united much of the nation after a period of bitter divisions over the war in Gaza, transforming the political landscape overnight as even Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's foes close ranks behind him.
articles.title: Angst over Gaza set aside as Netanyahu's critics back him over Iran

articles.author: Jonathan Saul, Renee Maltezou
articles.description: Commercial ships are sailing close to Oman and are being advised by maritime agencies to avoid Iran's waters around the Strait of Hormuz, with the risk of the conflict between Israel and Iran escalating, shipping sources said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Ships advised to keep their distance from Iran around Hormuz Strait

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Haiti's capital of Port-au-Prince was in the dark on Wednesday after residents of a nearby town stormed a dam and brought it offline in protest at government inaction over gang violence.
articles.title: Haiti's capital in the dark after residents storm hydroelectric plant

articles.author: Ana Mano, Tom Polansek
articles.description: Brazil's vast and diverse geography, with the Amazon to the north, mountain ranges along the Atlantic coast and the Andes to its west, may have helped it avoid the U.S. fate of widespread bird flu among commercial poultry flocks by keeping migratory birds away from farms in the country's interior.
articles.title: Geography helps shield Brazil from US-style bird flu epidemic, for now
